user_request: Clear the cart on walmart. Add usb-b to the cart on walmart
screen_desc: The screenshot displays a product listing on Walmart's mobile website for a Monoprice USB Type-A to USB Type-B 2.0 Cable, priced at $44.99. The product includes a pack of five 6-foot cables, and the item has a 4.5-star rating from 167 reviews. Below the product, there is an option to add it to the cart and select the quantity. A promotional ad for the Walmart shopping app appears at the bottom, encouraging users to download it for easier shopping and order tracking.
history_actions: click on the Chrome app icon located at the bottom right.
click on the address bar located at the top middle.
click on the first search suggestion "walmart.com" located just below the search bar
click on the search icon (a magnifying glass) located at the middle and upper part of the screen.
click on the cancel button located at the top right.
click on the shopping cart icon located at the top right.
click on the "Remove" button located at the lower left.
click on the cart icon located at the middle and upper part of the screen.
click on the "usb-b" search result located at upper left.
click on the "Add" button located at the right and lower middle part of the screen.

think.Thought: The user has requested to clear the cart and then to add a USB-B cable to the cart on Walmart. From the history actions, I see that the user has already attempted to clear the cart by clicking on the 'Remove' button previously, but it is not clear if the cart is currently empty. The user has clicked on the 'Add' button for the USB-B cable. The current screen shows the product page for a Monoprice USB Type-A to USB Type-B 2.0 Cable with the quantity set to 1, which suggests that the last action was likely adding this item to the cart. To confirm that the user's request has been fulfilled, I need to first verify that the cart has been cleared, and then check that the USB-B cable is indeed added to the cart. The appropriate next step is to navigate to the cart to check the current items in it.
